body_html:
hi,
Is this fixed?
When I run:

x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [1, 100, 9, 161])
cell = rnn.BasicLSTMCell(1024)
output, state = tf.nn.dynamic_rnn(cell, x, dtype=tf.float32)

I get such error:

ValueError: linear is expecting 2D arguments: [TensorShape([Dimension(1), Dimension(9), Dimension(161)]), TensorShape([Dimension(1), Dimension(1024)])]

version: tf 1.4.1

body:
hi,
Is this fixed? 
When I run:
```
x = tf.placeholder(tf.float32, [1, 100, 9, 161])
cell = rnn.BasicLSTMCell(1024)
output, state = tf.nn.dynamic_rnn(cell, x, dtype=tf.float32)
```
I get such error:
```
ValueError: linear is expecting 2D arguments: [TensorShape([Dimension(1), Dimension(9), Dimension(161)]), TensorShape([Dimension(1), Dimension(1024)])]
```
version: tf 1.4.1
